00020 /* \file DotProgress.h Provides a base class for displaying progress. */
00021 
00022 #ifndef _DotProgress_HEADER_
00023 #define _DotProgress_HEADER_
00024 
00025 #include "util/Progress.h"
00026 //
00027 #include <iostream>
00028 #include <ostream>
00029 //
00030 
00031 /*! Provides a class for showing progress with dots written to an output stream. */
00032 class DotProgress : public Progress
00033 {
00034 private:
00035         /*! Where to stream the messages. */
00036         std::ostream *outstr;
00037 
00038         /*! What level of messages is wanted, larger num == more msgs */
00039         int verbosity;
00040 
00041         /*! How often do we print a dot when dot() is called? */
00042         int dotMod;
00043         
00044         /*! How many times has dot() been called? */
00045         int dotCount;
00046 
00047 public:
00048 
00049         /*! Constructor
00050          * @param strm Where to stream the dots
00051          */
00052         DotProgress(std::ostream *strm = &std::cout);
00053   ~DotProgress() { }
00054 
00055         /*! Sets the upper limit of the range of the progress display.
00056          * @param level - level of verbosity desired.
00057          * @param mx The maximum number of steps in the task.
00058          * @param inc The number of steps performed before the progress display is updated.
00059          */
00060         void SetStepProperties(int level, int mx, int inc);
00061 
00062         /*! Steps the progress ahead by one count.
00063          * @param level - What level of verbosity this message should be printed at.
00064          */
00065         void Step(int level);
00066 };
00067 
00068 #endif
